conclusion: In a velocity-time (v-t) graph: The vertical axis represents velocity (v), The horizontal axis represents time (t), The curves show how the velocity of each object changes over time.
Curve A is the upper curve (with greater velocity values), Curve B is the lower curve.

The difference in speed between objects A and B at any time t is: Difference in speed = v₁(t) - v₂(t), Where v₁(t) is the velocity of object A at time t, And v₂(t) is the velocity of object B at time t.

premise: For the difference to be continuously increasing, the rate of change of velocity (acceleration) of object A must be greater than the rate of change of velocity of object B.
conclusion: The slope of curve A appears to be steeper than the slope of curve B initially.
As time progresses, both curves begin to flatten and then decrease.

premise: The rate of flattening/decrease appears different between the two curves.
conclusion: At t = 0, both objects start from rest (v = 0). Both objects accelerate (positive slope). The slope of curve A is steeper than curve B initially, meaning A accelerates faster.

premise: The slope of curve A is steeper than curve B initially, meaning A accelerates faster.
conclusion: This means the difference in speed is increasing at first.

premise: Curve A reaches its maximum and begins decreasing earlier than curve B.
conclusion: When curve A's slope becomes less than curve B's slope, the difference stops increasing.

premise: Based on the shape of the curves in the graph: Initially, the difference increases (A accelerates faster). At some point before t₁, curve A's slope becomes less than curve B's slope.
conclusion: At this point, the difference in speeds would start decreasing.

premise: The difference increases initially when object A accelerates faster than object B, but when object A's velocity begins to decrease more rapidly than object B's, the difference in speed begins to decrease.
conclusion: No, the difference in speed between the two objects is not continuously increasing throughout the time interval from 0 to t₁.
